metadata.feature_description: View and manage activity stream specific to groups

steps.action: Navigate to Groups page at http://localhost:8081/en-us/Groups
steps.expected: Groups listing page should display with available groups
steps.actual: Groups page displayed showing 'Wiki Test Group' with 1 member

steps.action: Navigate to Wiki Test Group's Activity tab
steps.expected: Group activity stream page should load with activity tab selected
steps.actual: Activity tab displayed with group-specific activity stream context. Activity area showed 'There is nothing in this activity stream' initially (empty state)

steps.action: Click on the post editor area to activate it
steps.expected: Post editor should activate and accept text input
steps.actual: Post editor activated with placeholder 'Write something...' visible

steps.action: Enter test post text: 'Test post to Wiki Test Group activity stream - testing group-specific activity feature'
steps.expected: Text should appear in editor with Share button enabled
steps.actual: Text entered successfully in editor, Share button became active

steps.action: Click Share button to submit the post
steps.expected: Post should be created and appear in the activity stream
steps.actual: Post successfully created and displayed in the group activity stream with author name 'SuperUser Account' and timestamp

steps.action: Click on 'Posts' filter option in the activity stream
steps.expected: Activity stream should filter to show only post-type activities
steps.actual: Filter applied successfully, the test post remained visible (it is a Post type)

steps.expected: Activity stream should filter to show only blog-type activities (none expected)
steps.actual: Filter applied, activity stream now shows 'There is nothing in this activity stream' since there are no blog posts - correctly filtering out non-blog content

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Moderate group posts as group admin

steps.action: Locate the Pin option on the post (moderation action for group admins)
steps.expected: Pin link should be visible for group administrators
steps.actual: Pin link visible on the post alongside Like and Comment options

steps.action: Click Pin to pin the post to the top of the activity stream
steps.expected: Post should be pinned and Pin link should change to Unpin
steps.actual: Post successfully pinned - the 'Pin' link changed to 'Unpin' indicating the post is now pinned

steps.action: Log out of the current session to view as anonymous user
steps.expected: User should be logged out and viewing as anonymous
steps.actual: Successfully logged out - Login/Register links visible in header instead of user name

steps.action: Navigate to the Wiki Test Group's Activity page as anonymous user
steps.expected: Group page should be accessible but activity stream should not show member posts
steps.actual: Group page accessible (public group), but activity stream shows 'There is nothing in this activity stream' - confirming the post created earlier is NOT visible to non-members

steps.action: Verify no post editor is available for non-members
steps.expected: Post editor should not be visible for non-group members
steps.actual: No post editor visible on the page - only the empty activity stream message is shown. 'Join Group' button visible indicating user is not a member. This confirms member-only visibility and posting restrictions are working correctly.

observations: Code review confirmed group activity stream uses GroupId parameter to filter activities specific to the group context (ActivityStreamServicesController.cs GetListForProfile method)
The View.ascx.cs code shows explicit member-only posting logic: if user is not in group role, ShowEditor is set to false and CanComment is set to false (lines 219-230)
Security sets in posts use 'R' (Role) designation for group-specific visibility, ensuring only group members can view group activity
Pin/Unpin moderation functionality is available to group admins via the TogglePin method in ActivityStreamServicesController.cs (lines 344-361)
The group activity stream correctly handles both public and private group types with appropriate visibility rules

Additional test scenarios suggested in prompt (Test group activity with different group types, Leave group and verify access removal) were not executed as they would require additional group setup or group membership changes that go beyond the scope of thorough testing for High priority
